snippet: The planned airborne launcher — funded by Paul Allen, a Microsoft founder — is more than three-quarters finished, but questions about its business model linger.
abstract: Vulcan Aerospace project known as Stratolaunch is on track to begin commercial operations before 2020, despite questions about how its business of revolutionizing access to space will work; project, funded largely by Microsoft founder Paul G Allen, seeks to create flying platform that can launch rockets into space.

byline.original: By NICK WINGFIELD and KENNETH CHANG

lead_paragraph: The planned airborne launcher — funded by Paul Allen, a Microsoft founder — is more than three-quarters finished, but questions about its business model linger.

headline.main: Stratolaunch’s Gargantuan Flying Launchpad Edges Toward the Skies
headline.print_headline: Colossal Flying Launcher Edges Toward the Skies
